contentrichtext.text: {{selfref|For information about pending changes protection on Wikipedia, see [[Wikipedia:Pending changes]].}} '''PCP''' may refer to: In '''business''': * Previous corresponding period (Used when comparing sales over corresponding periods) In '''medicine''' and '''pharmaceutics''': *[[Phencyclidine]], a recreational drug known by a number of street names including PCP, angel dust, embalming fluid, and rocket fuel *[[Primary care physician]], a doctor who acts as first point of consultation for patients *[[Paramedics in Canada#Primary Care Paramedics|Primary care paramedic]] *[[Pneumocystis pneumonia]], a form of pneumonia caused by the yeast-like fungus *[[Post-coital pill]], a form of emergency contraception *[[Pharmacy Council of Pakistan]] In '''politics''': *[[Paraguayan Communist Party]] *Partido Comunista del Peru, also known as [[Shining Path]] *[[Personal Choice Party]], Utah *[[Peruvian Communist Party]] *[[Portuguese Communist Party]] *[[Proletarian Catalan Party]] *[[Puerto Rican Communist Party]] In '''science''': *[[Post correspondence problem]], an important problem in computability theory *[[Parallel coordinate plot]], a method for visualizing multivariate data *[[PCP theorem]], a theorem in computational complexity theory *[[Pentachlorophenol]], an organochlorine compound used as a timber preservative herbicide, insecticide, fungicide and algaecide *[[Priority ceiling protocol]], a computer science concept *[[Probabilistically checkable proof (complexity)]], a notion in the theory of computational complexity *[[Putâ€“call parity]], in financial mathematics a relationship between the price of a call option and a put option *[[Lysosomal Pro-X carboxypeptidase]], an enzyme In '''technology''': * [[Performance Co-Pilot]], an open-source performance monitoring system * [[Air gun#Pre-charged pneumatic .28PCP.29|Pre-charged pneumatic]], a type of air gun * [[IEEE P802.1p#Priority levels|Priority Code Point]], a three-bit priority field within an Ethernet frame header when using IEEE 802.1q tagged frames. * [[Puppet_(software)|Puppet]] Certified Professional, someone who has passed the certification exam, proving proficiency in using Puppet. In '''Theoretical Computer Science''': * [[Probabilistically checkable proof]], a proof that can be checked by a randomized algorithm using bounded randomness and bounded number of proof bits. '''Miscellaneous''': *"[[Faster/P.C.P.]]", a single by Manic Street Preachers, from their 1994 album ''The Holy Bible'' *[[Purple City Productions]], a Harlem-based rap group *[[Personal contract purchase]], a vehicle financing product *[[Principia Cybernetica Project]], an organization and website devoted to evolutionary-cybernetic philosophy *Perfect Crime Party, a fictional manga in ''[[Bakuman]]'' {{disambig}}
